Class BaseEventBusWithLookUp

java.lang.Object
  com.mvp4g.client.event.BaseEventBus
      com.mvp4g.client.event.BaseEventBusWithLookUp
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventBus, EventBusWithLookup
public abstract class BaseEventBusWithLookUp
extends BaseEventBus
implements EventBusWithLookup

Abstract implementation of EventBusWithLookup. This class should only be used by the framework.

public BaseEventBusWithLookUp()
Method Detail

dispatch

public abstract void dispatch(java.lang.String eventName,
                              java.lang.Object... data)
Description copied from interface: EventBusWithLookup
Call the method associated with the event name in order to trigger the presenters that can handle the event. Forward to the handler the object associated with the event.

The event is stored in GWT History stack if possible (ie if an History Converter is associated with the event) and needed (ie isHistoryStored() == true).

Specified by:
dispatch in interface EventBusWithLookup
Parameters:
eventName - name of the event to dispatch
data - objects to fire with the event

dispatch

public void dispatch(java.lang.String eventName)
Description copied from interface: EventBusWithLookup
Call the method associated with the event name in order to trigger the presenters that can handle the event. In this case no object is forwarded to the handler(s).

The event is stored in GWT History stack if possible (ie if an History Converter is associated with the event) and needed (ie isHistoryStored() == true).

Calling dispatch(eventName) is equivalent to calling dispatch(eventName, null).

Specified by:
dispatch in interface EventBusWithLookup
Parameters:
eventName - name of the event to dispatch

dispatch

public <E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> void dispatch(java.lang.Enum<E> enumEventName,
                                                   java.lang.Object... data)
Description copied from interface: EventBusWithLookup
Call the method associated with the event name in order to trigger the presenters that can handle the event. Forward to the handler the object associated with the event.
In this function, the name is given as a enumeration. The toString method of this enumeration must return the name of the event as defined in the configuration.

The event is stored in GWT History stack if possible (ie if an History Converter is associated with the event) and needed (ie isHistoryStored() == true).

Calling dispatch(enumEventName, form) is equivalent to calling dispatch(enumEventName.toString(), form).

Specified by:
dispatch in interface EventBusWithLookup
Parameters:
enumEventName - name of the event to dispatch
data - objects to fire with the event

dispatch

public <E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> void dispatch(java.lang.Enum<E> enumEventName)
Description copied from interface: EventBusWithLookup
Call the method associated with the event name in order to trigger the presenters that can handle the event. In this case no object is forwarded to the handler(s).

In this function, the name is given as a enumeration. The toString method of this enumeration must return the name of the event as defined in the configuration.

The event is stored in GWT History stack if possible (ie if an History Converter is associated with the event) and needed (ie isHistoryStored() == true).

Calling dispatch(enumEventName) is equivalent to calling dispatch(enumEventName.toString(), null).

Specified by:
dispatch in interface EventBusWithLookup
Parameters:
enumEventName - name of the event to dispatch

handleClassCastException

protected void handleClassCastException(java.lang.ClassCastException e,
                                        java.lang.String eventName)
When a ClassCastException is thrown while executing dispatch method, verify if it is thrown by this class. If it's the case, then send an Mvp4gException to indicate that an object with the wrong class type has been sent with the event.

Parameters:
e - ClassCastException thrown
eventName - name of the event dispatched while error is thrown
